RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 32000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of two races since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A race since then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races where e ntered for $16,000 or less not considered).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY PLACE tracked the front runners while taking the inside route, sat reserved biding time during the last stages of the run around the bend, was given her cue and angled sharply three wide into the stretch, emerged from the furlong grounds as the new leader, extended the winning margin, kept to a light drive. ISLAND CANDY prompted the pace from the two path, issued a challenge after the half had been completed, proved no match for the winner while holding on well to secure second. SOUTH SOUND broke on top and established control, pilot aboard with a firm grip on the reins, took up position in the two path, with the runner up in close attendance one path wider, was put to the test nearing the quarter pole, got called upon, yet succumbed, drifted out steadily during the final furlong. MY GOLDEN GIRL underwent a four wide pursuit on the turn, tired. HEIDI'S HOLIDAY off a beat slower than any other, tucked along the rail before reaching the end of the backstretch, cut the corner into the stretch, had no offering. WILDICHI put to a prolonged drive, was four wide midway on the turn, gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Wildichi
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w 3/8, long drive, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: My Place
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: track ins,bide time1/4,sharply 3w into lane, kick away,lite drive

ENTRY.NAME: Heidi's Holiday
ENTRY.COMMENT: off beat slow, cut corner, no offering

ENTRY.NAME: Island Candy
ENTRY.OWNER: Epona Racing Stable and CJC Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 2p, bid 1/4,held well place

ENTRY.NAME: My Golden Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit on turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: South Sound
ENTRY.OWNER: Schwartz, Barry K. and Dahlman, Ernest
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick control (own power),rated 2p,overhauled,drift out final 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Claiming Purse 40000. (UP TO $7,200 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMERICAS GUEST secured a forward position after the start, proceeded down the backstretch, well off the inside and fighting with some force on the left side of the bit, entered the turn from the four path, pressed the issue all throughout the next quarter, got set down spinning into the lane, took over by midstretch, drew off, put to a brisk hand ride for the final seventy yards. HI SPEED CHASE was hand urged after leaving the starting gate to establish command, remained under some coaxing, however much lighter than before after achieving the goal, took up residence in the two path while showing the way, came under attack as the second split was being set and was set down for the drive, got overhauled by the winner soon afterwards, but continued onward well enough to secure second. DICKENS prompted the pace from the three path for nearly a half, arrived at the quarter pole having already been roused, proved no match for the top twosome. A TOUCH OF POETRY tucked along the rail down the backstretch, got put to a drive by the five-sixteenths pole, picked up momentum cutting the corner into the stretch, launched a rail run during the ensuing furlong to loom a threat by midlane, flattened out. ARTEMUS PAPERBOY saved ground to no avail. DO IT FOR DENNIS four wide and asked for run midpoint on the turn, swung two paths wider into upper stretch, mustered up a mild response to mainly improve position. BOSS DADDY stumbled at the start, took up the chase from the two path on the turn, gave way. WE FLY PRIVATE off a beat slow after taking an awkward step inward, raced from off the inside, commenced the stretch from the four path, had no response. CALHOUN HILL strung out three wide at the three-eighths pole, was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Boss Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, chased 2p turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: A Touch of Poetry
ENTRY.COMMENT: rode rail, drive by 5/16, rail run 1/4-1/8,flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Artemus Paperboy
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Do It for Dennis
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w & asked 3/8,came 6w into upper, mildly to improve

ENTRY.NAME: Calhoun Hill
ENTRY.COMMENT: strung out 3w 3/8, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Americas Guest
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Sahn, Robert I.
ENTRY.COMMENT: fought bit early,4w,press pace, bid 1/4,drew off,brisk hand late

ENTRY.NAME: Hi Speed Chase
ENTRY.COMMENT: hand urge to lead,coax 2p,let out 1/4,held well for place

ENTRY.NAME: We Fly Private
ENTRY.OWNER: Treadway Racing Stable and Cook, Alan R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off beat slow (awkward 1st step),put 4w top of lane,no offering

ENTRY.NAME: Dickens
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3p, roused prior to 1/4, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 107. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 65000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $13,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $40,000. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of two races other than Claiming, or Starter since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such a race since then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $25,000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LAILA'S JAZZ prompted the pace from the three path, latched on fully to THE BIG DEUCE approaching the quarter pole and challenged in earnest, won the fight through the furlong grounds to poke a head down in front, but with the runner up looming a bold threat to the left, held on well enough long enough to preserve the decision. GROUND FORCE along the rail for the majority of the way down the backstretch, chose the two path as the route to go by around the bend, got asked for a response for the drive home, kicked into his best stride past the eighth pole, missed. THE BIG DELUXE broke inward, was pulled away from LONGFOR THE CITY but not before making contact with that rival, went on to take the advantage, was rated while cutting the pace in the two path, with the eventual winner keeping watch one path farther off the inside, had that rival increase his presence after going a half, got let out in response to the challenge, yielded nearing the furlong marker and backed away. FLYING ZEALOUS bumped from both sides right after the start, raced three to four wide on the bend, swung into the five path heading home, had no rally. LONGFOR THE CITY brushed a few strides out of the starting gate, was guided over to the inside route coming to the end of the backstretch, faltered off the subsequent ground-saving journey.

ENTRY.NAME: Ground Force
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside early,chased 2p turn, belatedly,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Laila's Jazz
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt 3p,bid turning for home,just held on

ENTRY.NAME: Longfor the City
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush after start, to inside 9/16,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Zealous
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump between foes start, 3-4w turn, 5w into lane, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: The Big Deluxe
ENTRY.OWNER: Bran Jam Stable and Clark, David W.
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in,bump after brk;rate 2p to 1/4,weaken final furlong

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 7F Turf CR: 105. Claiming Purse 47000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of two races since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A race since then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races where entered for $20,000 or less not considered) (Winners P referred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the main track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRETENSION away well, crossed to the inside shortly after the start, cut a sharp pace under very light coaxing, got let out spinning just off the inside for home, came under challenge by LAY IT DOWN a furlong out as that foe got nearly latched on, turned back that challenge inching away again slightly a sixteenth out and held well and safe to the wire kept to task. EMKANAAT (GB) broke out at the start bumping ANIMAL STYLE, settled just off the inside in mid pack behind cover, got let out swinging three wide for home, offered up a mild kick through the final eighth to secure the place honors. LAY IT DOWN forwardly placed just off the inside in closest aim of the front, got set down three wide into upper stretch, rallied to get nearly latched on to the eventual winner issuing a challenge a furlong from home, got turned back by that foe not having enough to keep pace late while just holding for the show honors late on. PRECIOUS METAL three wide towards the rear initially, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, angled inside and cut the corner into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to procure the last major share in the late stages. KARAKORUM LEGEND tracked the pace along the inside in range of the front, angled sharply four wide into upper stretch put to a drive, weakened in the late stages. BACK AWAY three wide in mid pack, came under urging three furlongs out, made a three to four wide bid advancing mildly before swinging five wide for home negating the minor ground claimed and weakened in the stretch. TIGER WILLIE just off the inside towards the rear, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, angled three wide for home, offered no response. BEELINER under a firm hold early on in a bit tight just off the inside, shifted to the three path five furlongs out to be in the clear, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, spun four wide for home and tired in the drive. ANIMAL STYLE bobbled slightly at the start then was bumped by EMKANAAT who broke outwards, settled three to four wide towards the rear, raced choppy-gaited through the far turn growing detached from the main body of the field and was eased in the stretch and subsequently vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Precious Metal
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w towards rear, asked 5/16, cut corner, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Karakorum Legend
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside in range, angled 4w upper, weakened late stages

ENTRY.NAME: Emkanaat (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Omega Racing Stable and Roth, Toby
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out st, mid pack 2p, let out 3w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Animal Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled, bumped st, 3-4w towards rear, choppy, eased, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Tiger Willie
ENTRY.COMMENT: towards rear 2p, urged 5/16, 3w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Beeliner
ENTRY.COMMENT: firm hold early 2p, to 3p 5/8, asked near 1/4, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lay It Down
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 2p, set down 3w upper, rallied, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Pretension
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, cut sharp pace inside, let out 2w 1/4p, held well

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Sequel Thoroughbreds LLC & A. Lakin & Sons Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Back Away
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w mid pack, urged 3/8, 3-4w bid 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 95. Allowance Purse 77000. INNER TURF (UP TO $13,860 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming, Or Starter At A Mi le Or Over Since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming, Or Starter At Any Distance Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $25,000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CANDIR away in good order, settled into midpack, sat reserved from off the inside racing down the backstretch, departed it from three path, swung four wide into the stretch and took off in earnest after the front runners, collared them, wresting away the advantage with seventy yards remaining. DOBRA HISTORIA sat forwardly placed two to three around both turns, drafted behind PEACEFUL TALK for a portion of the run around the second one, angled three wide into the stretch, made up a minimal amount of ground during the ensuing furlong, cut into the deficit more readily thereafter, fought his way to a slim and short-lived advantage with slightly under a sixteenth remaining, had it snatched away by top one and had to settle for the place. TRECASTLE towards the inside during the initial stages, slipped into the two path after going three-quarters, fanned outward traversing through the furlong grounds until five to six wide with an eighth to go, came home with belated energy to take the show award. STRONG STIPULATION hung out three wide on the opening bend, the widest of all, raced closer to the rail on the subsequent one, got put to a drive leaving the five-sixteenths pole, gained ground steadily down the lane. PEACEFUL TALK off to an alert beginning, quickly took control, cut the pace at or near the two path on a loosely-contested lead to the quarter pole, got put to encouragement entering the stretch, relinquished near the sixteenth pole and backed away. ARCH AVENGER off a beat slower than the penultimate breaker, saved ground for the majority of the way to the half mile pole, spun four wide into the stretch, made no headway. SIGNATURE SEVEN along the inside route and urged on the second bend, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Trecastle
ENTRY.COMMENT: towards inside,slip 2p 5/16,fan 5-6w 1/8,belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Peaceful Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: at/near 2p,set down drive, yielded past 1/16,backed away

ENTRY.NAME: Signature Seven
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside & urged 2nd turn, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Dobra Historia
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w turns,draft behind leader 2nd,3w top lane,slim late lead

ENTRY.NAME: Candir
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried midpack,3w 2nd,4w into lane,took over final 70 yards

ENTRY.NAME: Arch Avenger
ENTRY.COMMENT: off beat slow,inside early, 2p 2nd,4w into lane, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Stipulation
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, 2p 2nd, drive past 5/16, closed in

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 34000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOLLY'S MISCHIEF saved ground towards the rear, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied willingly steadily gaining through the final eighth and went on by in the late stages to prevail inching away at the end. BRENDAN G three to four wide in close aim vying with a pair to the inside, got set down three wide into upper stretch taking over command, inched away to the eighth pole under a drive, dug in under threat in the final sixteenth and was caught in the late stages while clear for the place honors. PATTY AND NOOCHE three wide in pursuit from just off the pace, got placed to urging three furlongs out, angled five wide into upper stretch, improved position for the show honors. ICE WAGON broke in at the start bumping GREG'S INTUITION, chased the front inside in range, cut the corner under a drive into upper stretch, got bounced off the rail by GREG'S INTUITION at the three-sixteenths while offering a mild kick, then weakened in the late stages. SUNRISE LOVER hustled from the gate after breaking a bit awkwardly, chased two to three wide under urging from midway on the turn, angled four wide for home and tired in the stretch. TWO SEVENTEEN vied two to three wide between foes with GREG'S INTUITION to his inside under pressure from the outside by BRENDAN G while under coaxing, spun just off the inside for home fading from that pace fight and gave way at the three-sixteenths. GREG'S INTUITION bumped at the start by ICE WAGON who broke inwards, vied inside a pair through the turn under urging from the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch leaving a seam along the inside straightened away, had the rider take a glance back, floated over to bounce ICE WAGON into the rail at the three-sixteenths before tiring in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Solly's Mischief
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Aisquith, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd towards rear, asked 5/16, angled 4w upper, up late on

ENTRY.NAME: Greg's Intuition
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, vied inside a pair, cut corner, bumped foe 3/16, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Wagon
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, chased ins in aim, cut corner, bounced off rail, wkd

ENTRY.NAME: Patty and Nooche
ENTRY.OWNER: MeB Racing Stables LLC and Brooklyn Boyz Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, asked 3/8, 5w upper, improved for show

ENTRY.NAME: Two Seventeen
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2-3w coaxed along, gave way 3/16

ENTRY.NAME: Brendan G
ENTRY.OWNER: Bob Petersons Stables, LLC and Lodico, Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3-4w, set down 3w upper, inched away, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Sunrise Lover
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2-3w, asked 3/8, 4w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1M Turf CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. (UP TO $13,500 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $40,000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the main track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VISION PERFECT saved ground for nearly three-quarters, angled three wide into the stretch, forged his way to the front past the furlong grounds, dug in with good determination under a hand drive late to preserve the decision. KING OF NEW YORK three wide on the chute, raced closer to the rail on the full turn, swung four wide into the stretch, displayed good energy down the center of the course. LUCKY LEROY BROWN three wide to the quarter pole, was driven into the five path heading home, rallied belatedly for the show. ROYAL SQUEEZE ducked in leaving the starting gate, set the pace while taking the inside route, got let out let after going six furlongs, surrendered with slightly under a furlong remaining and backed away. ANIMAL KRACKER carried towards the rail by a wayward ROYAL SQUEEZE, saved ground to the five-sixteenths pole, lacked the needed response. COMMAND CONTROL hit the left side of the starting gate, took up the chase from the two path, had no rally. SUPA stalked the pace from the two path, got let out a notch past the half mile pole, kept pressing the issue up for six furlongs then gave way. GOLDEN LUCK strung out four wide on the chute, continued from well off the inside, was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w chute, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Animal Kracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Valor International and Frassetto Albert
ENTRY.COMMENT: carried in start, saved ground to 5/16,flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Squeeze
ENTRY.OWNER: Covello, James, Coleman, Thomas and Doheny Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: duck in start,coaxed ins,let out after 3/4's,yielded,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vision Perfect
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground for 6F, angled 3w into lane,dug in,hand drive late

ENTRY.NAME: Command Control
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit left side gate, chased 2p, had no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Supa
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2p, out notch past 1/2,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Leroy Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w to 1/4,driven 5w into upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: King of New York
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w chute, let out past 3/8, 4w into lane, good kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 107. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 80000. INNER TURF (UP TO $14,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of two races other than Claiming, or Starter at a mile or over since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such a race since then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $25, 000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOES BLAZING AARON established the pace in hand along the inside, was given some rein and shook away nearing the quarter pole, got roused at the head of the stretch spinning just off the inside for home with a couple of off sided shoulder taps, edged clear under a vigorous hand ride and remained safe ridden out to the wire. ARTIC NORTH saved ground while rated in mid pack, got set down just off the inside at the head of the stretch, offered up a mild kick for the place honors. RED VINE tracked the pace along the inside in range of the front, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide for home and kept on mildly for the show honors. SHOCK LEADER saved ground towards the rear, came under a ride at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, kicked on mildly for the last major share. STAR CHANNEL just off the inside in close range of the leader, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the stretch. ROYAL BLESSING tossed his head then bobbled at the start, recovered to settle two to three wide in mid pack in hand, remained patiently handled until set down two to three wide at the top of the stretch, made no headway. CAPITAN FUTURO (GB) two to three wide towards the rear, got spirited up three furlongs out, cornered three to four wide for home, made no impact. HORVAT CLAN two to three wide in hand just off the pace, got released midway on the far turn, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, tired in a drive. MANACOR (IRE) three to four wide in mid pack, came under urging at the three-eighths, grew detached from the main body of the field through the latter turn and was not persevered with in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Joes Blazing Aaron
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, shook away 1/4p, edged away, vigorous hand ride

ENTRY.NAME: Red Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside in range, asked 5/16, 3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Horvat Clan
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w just off pace, asked 3/8, 4-5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Artic North
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated saving grd mid pack, asked 1/4p, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Blessing
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head, bobbled st, 2-3w mid pack, 3w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Star Channel
ENTRY.OWNER: Alastar Thoroughbred Company LLC and Valdes, Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p in close range, asked 5/16, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Manacor (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w mid pack, urged 3/8, grew detached latter turn, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Capitan Futuro (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Valor International, Brous Stable and Wachtel Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w towards rear, asked 3/8, 3-4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Shock Leader
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd towards rear, asked 5/16, 2w 1/4p, mild kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Yankee Affair S. BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/2M Turf CR: 114. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 each which should accompany the nomination; $500 to pass the entry box and an additional $500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,000 along with the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight s, three year olds, 118 lbs. Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded Sweepstake in 2013-14 allowed 2 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2014, 4 lbs.; of one such race in 2014, 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning own er. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. Closed Saturday, August 23, 2014 with 20 Original Nominations and 2 Supplements. (If the Stewards consider it in advisable to run this race on the turf course,
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED RIFLE assumed the role of primary pursuer after getting away in good order, kept watch on the leader from the two path, moved when ready approaching the quarter pole, took away the advantage from a much more energetically-handled foe, was almost at the three-sixteenths pole before asked for a response himself, gave one, dug in with good determination to fend off the lone stretch threat. REFLECTING shied inward and away from a bumping pair at the start, chased the pace from the two path, tipped into the third one at the five-sixteenths marker in preparation for the stretch, got called spinning into the lane, cut into deficit steadily but had to settle for the place. ELNAAWI made solid contact with SLIM SHADEY after lunging inward as the field was sent off and running, took control and was guided over towards the inside, got rated setting the splits, with the eventual winner in close attendance in the two path, continued along under the same conditions until the last stages of the run around the second bend, yielded putting up little resistance when challenged by the top one, despite having been called upon, backed away down the lane. DUCKS DOCK took up the chase primarily from the two path until the quarter pole, commenced the stretch one path wider, had no offering. SLIM SHADEY (GB) bumped at the start, saved ground to upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Reflecting
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in,sluggish start,chase 2p,tip 3p 5/16,willingly for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Slim Shadey (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, saved ground to upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Elnaawi
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunge in,bumped start,rated inside to 1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ducks Dock
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mostly 2p, 3w into lane, no offering

ENTRY.NAME: Red Rifle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2p,when ready 1/4,roused 3/16,dug in stubbornly

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Twin Creeks Farm, Tom Clark & Nancy Clark

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 41000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $16,00 0 or Less In The Last Start Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIRE SHIP broke out at the start and was corrected, attended the pace just off the inside in hand, came under coaxing spinning three to four wide for home, seized command straightened away, inched away to the eighth pole, dug in under a drive and held safe through to the wire. MINI MUFFIN rushed the gate just prior to the break then broke awkwardly, settled just off the inside towards the rear, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, drifted out through the stretch to the wire despite an off sided stick and pulling on the near side rein by the rider while closing well through to the finish to garner the place honors. LIL' ZILLA in hand just off the pace in the two path, came under a ride at the three-eighths, angled four wide for home, offered up a mild kick for the show honors. SWEETDREAMSABOUTME settled three wide in mid pack, came under urging midway on the far turn, angled five wide for home, kicked home mildly and belatedly for the last major share. CHRISSY GIRL just off the inside in mid pack, got put to encouragement at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch, made no late headway. LA DAMA DE HIERRO away well, was eased back off of KEEP RIGHT to track that foe along the inside, came under urging midway on the far turn, angled three wide for home and weakened. KEEP RIGHT cut the pace along the two path until shifting to the inside six furlongs out, remained in hand until set down under challenge from the eventual winner nearing the quarter pole, spun just off the inside for home, got headed once straightened away at the three-sixteenths and weakened in the stretch. LUPICAIA three wide throughout in pursuit, came under urging midway on the far turn, weakened in the stretch. JACEY'S REVENGE brushed the off side stall at the start, settled three wide towards the rear, shifted to the rail at the half mile pole, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner for home, offered no response. CATHASNOMANNERS steadied briefly at the start as FIRE SHIP broke outwards, was outrun early on growing detached from the main body of the field and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Mini Muffin
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, 2p near rear, 6w upper, drifted out finishing well

ENTRY.NAME: La Dama de Hierro
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, eased back to track ins, urged 3/8, 3w 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Chrissy Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: The Three Colleens Stable and Parting Glass Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack 2p, asked 5/16, cut corner, no late headway

ENTRY.NAME: Keep Right
ENTRY.COMMENT: cut pace inside, set down 1/4p, headed 3/16, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Fire Ship
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out st, attended 2p, 3-4w upper, up 3/16, inched away

ENTRY.NAME: Cathasnomanners
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied st, outrun early on, detached and last, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetdreamsaboutme
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w mid pack, asked 3/8, 5w upper, mild belated kick

ENTRY.NAME: Jacey's Revenge
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed gate st, towards rear 3p, asked 5/16, cut corner, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lil' Zilla
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p just off pace, asked 3/8, 4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lupicaia
ENTRY.OWNER: Bond, Tina Marie and Happy Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, asked 3/8, 3w upper, weakened
